hints.title: Hypoellipticity with Companion-Dependent Fitness
hints.content:
4912: :label: thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
4913: 
4914: The Geometric Gas generator:
4915: 
4916: $$
4917: \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} = \sum_{i=1}^k \left[v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} - \nabla_{x_i} U(x_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} - \gamma v_i \cdot \nabla_{v_i} + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_{v_i} - \varepsilon_F \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i}\right]
4918: 
4919: $$
4920: 
4921: is **hypoelliptic** in the sense of Hörmander.

hints.raw_directive:
4909: The C^∞ regularity of $V_{\text{fit}}$ has profound implications for the spectral properties of the Geometric Gas Langevin operator.

4911: :::{prf:theorem} Hypoellipticity with Companion-Dependent Fitness
4912: :label: thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
4913: 
4914: The Geometric Gas generator:
4915:

4917: \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} = \sum_{i=1}^k \left[v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} - \nabla_{x_i} U(x_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} - \gamma v_i \cdot \nabla_{v_i} + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_{v_i} - \varepsilon_F \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i}\right]
4918: 
4919: $$
4920: 
4921: is **hypoelliptic** in the sense of Hörmander.

hints.label: proof-thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
hints.content:
4927: :label: proof-thm-hypoellipticity-companion-dependent-full
4928: 
4929: **Step 1: Kinetic operator hypoellipticity.**
4930: 
4931: The underdamped Langevin operator:
4932: 
4933: $$
4934: \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}} = \sum_{i=1}^k \left[v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} - \nabla_{x_i} U(x_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} - \gamma v_i \cdot \nabla_{v_i} + \frac{\sigma^2}{2} \Delta_{v_i}\right]
4935: 
4936: $$
4937: 
4938: satisfies **Hörmander's condition**: the Lie algebra generated by the drift and diffusion vector fields spans the tangent space $T(\mathcal{X}^k \times (\mathbb{R}^d)^k)$ at each point.
4939: 
4940: This is a standard result for underdamped Langevin dynamics (see Hérau & Nier, 2004).
4941: 
4942: **Step 2: Adaptive force as C^∞ first-order perturbation.**
4943: 
4944: The adaptive force term:
4945: 
4946: $$
4947: \mathcal{L}_{\text{adapt}} = -\varepsilon_F \sum_{i=1}^k \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i) \cdot \nabla_{v_i}
4948: 
4949: $$
4950: 
4951: is a **C^∞ first-order vector field** by {prf:ref}`thm-main-complete-cinf-geometric-gas-full`. The "first-order" designation is crucial: $\mathcal{L}_{\text{adapt}}$ contains only first derivatives ($\nabla_{v_i}$), not second derivatives, ensuring stability under perturbation theory.
4952: 
4953: **Step 3: Perturbation theory for hypoelliptic operators.**
4954: 
4955: By the theory of Hörmander (1967): a **C^∞ first-order perturbation** of a hypoelliptic operator **preserves hypoellipticity**.
4956: 
4957: Since $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ is hypoelliptic and $\mathcal{L}_{\text{adapt}}$ is a C^∞ perturbation:
4958: 
4959: $$
4960: \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{adapt}}
4961: 
4962: $$
4963: 
4964: is hypoelliptic.
